Catalano.Imaging.Corners

Class Fast12

  • java.lang.Object
    • Catalano.Imaging.Corners.Fast12

  • public class Fast12
extends java.lang.Object
    Features from Accelerated Segment Test (FAST) corners detector. In the FAST corner detection algorithm, a pixel is defined as a corner if (in a circle surrounding the pixel), N or more contiguous pixels are all significantly brighter then or all significantly darker than the center pixel. The ordering of questions used to classify a pixel is learned using the ID3 algorithm. This detector has been shown to exibit a high degree of repeatability.

    • Method Detail

      • getThreshold

        public int getThreshold()
        Get Threshold. A number denoting how much brighter or darker the pixels surrounding the pixel in question should be in order to be considered a corner.
        Returns:
        Threshold.

      • setThreshold

        public void setThreshold(int threshold)
        Set Threshold. A number denoting how much brighter or darker the pixels surrounding the pixel in question should be in order to be considered a corner.
        Parameters:
        threshold - Threshold.

      • isSuppressed

        public boolean isSuppressed()
        Check if needs apply a non-maximum suppression algorithm on the results, to allow only maximal corners.
        Returns:
        If true, allow only maximal corners, otherwise false.

      • setSuppression

        public void setSuppression(boolean suppress)
        Set suppression if needs apply a non-maximum suppression algorithm on the results, to allow only maximal corners.
        Parameters:
        suppress - If true, allow only maximal corners, otherwise false.
